definition: lit. to see a gap and stick in a needle (idiom); fig. to make use of every second and every inch
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
seam/crack/narrow slit/CL:道[dao4]
to sew/to stitch
to insert/stick in/pierce/to take part in/to interfere/to interpose
needle/pin/injection/stitch/CL:根[gen1],支[zhi1]

sentences.english: They issue the standard almost all business ground of make use of every bit of time or space moved China.
sentences.chinese: 他們幾乎把旗下所有業務都見縫插針地搬到了中國。

sentences.english: Motorcycles can make use of every bit of space, not bothered by traffic.
sentences.chinese: 摩托車可以見縫插針，不受堵車之累。

sentences.english: Somewhere on the trip we even fit in a round of miniature golf.
sentences.chinese: 我們甚至見縫插針，在旅途中打了一局迷你高爾夫。

definition: to be clogged up/to be congested (traffic, computer network etc)
to become a mere formality
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
lit. fight minutes, snatch seconds (idiom); a race against time/making every second count
to treat the symptoms/reactive (rather than proactive)
disproof/rebuttal/reductio ad absurdum
time bomb
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
extremely difficult/even more difficult
like a swarm of bees/everyone swarms around pushing and shouting/a hornet's nest
to force someone to do something
foothold
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
dangers spring up all around (idiom); surrounded by perils
urban heat island effect
